alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 4:31PM EDT until March 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONTGOMERY AND NORTHERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 430 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over East Norriton, or 15 miles northwest of Philadelphia, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 330 and 345. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 32. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 26 and 28. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 333 and 334. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 17 and 19. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Ambler, Collegeville, Jenkintown, Trappe, Rockledge, Abington, Schwenksville, Bryn Athyn, Wissinoming, Willow Grove, Germantown and Northeast Philadelphia. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
